body:
> @srehmann
> However, I think, Can you add a corresponding test case to ensure the correctness of your code?
> 
> There are a lot of test cases in zeppelin. You can find code that is similar to yours. Change to a test case that meets your requirements.
> I know to add test cases, There may be a little trouble, But this will ensure the correctness of your code. And can let others not destroy your code.
> Can you try adding test cases?

May I add a test case even if the CI is passed? You will merge once test cases are defined or is it merged even without test cases?
CI passed successfully. I have updated the CI link in the PR.
Deleted test code and [CI Pass](https://travis-ci.org/liuxunorg/zeppelin/builds/566412239)

@srehmann CI passes or fails, Before the code is merged, You can modify the code multiple times.
So, you can continue to add test cases. :-)
I will try.
Modify `Environment` to `Configuration` and [CI Pass](https://travis-ci.org/liuxunorg/zeppelin/builds/566758681)
Will merge if no more comments
[CI Pass](https://travis-ci.org/liuxunorg/zeppelin/builds/567315497)
Will merge if no more comments
@zjffdu Please review. Code review changes have been made. PR against master will include context.getLocalProperties() check
Thanks @jpmcmu Overall +1, just one missing thing is the document. Could you add that ? Thanks

@Reamer Any use experience issue you hit ?
I doesn't recognize any issue,which relates directly to this issue. Sometimes the spark-interpreter timeout doesn't work in kubernetes , maybe it's related to this issue.

Often encountered, sometimes the interpreter can not be closed and restarted in the note, will not be related to the problem of thrift, the system can be closed when testing, but often can not restart the interpreter online.
I am also often troubled by this problem. Thank you for solving this problem.
Thanks @woowahan-jaehoon for pointing out this issue. I believe this is regression issue caused by other PR. I am fine to disable it considering the frontend is too old.
same issue on interpreter page. would you mind addressing this as well?
@zjffdu Documentation has been added
LGTM
ping @Byeol
ping @yx91490 Do you have time to continue this work ?
@ShamsUlAzeem  I like too this feature. Any progress ?

[CI Pass](https://travis-ci.org/liuxunorg/zeppelin/builds/571349155)
Will merge if no more comments
ping @ShamsUlAzeem Could you resolve the conflict ? I will help to review it after that.
@zjffdu Sure. I'll complete this feature this/next weekend.

> hi @curlsli, Can you attach a screenshot of the system after modifying the code in the PR?
> This way you can see the effect of the run.

okey
ping @woowahan-jaehoon
@jpmcmu Could you update this PR to add supporting local property and docs ?
@srehmann ping? :-)

> ping @yx91490 Do you have time to continue this work ?

wait for your reply...

How do I proceed with writing the test case? In terms that my fix is not lost for merge?
Follow this:

> git fetch upstream
> git checkout ZP3065
> git rebase upstream/master
> git push -f origin ZP3065:ZP3065

???
Btw, I can see a very close related test case already present. Though the test case was working fine, but not the actual code :-)
@srehmann You can put the screenshot of the running interface after fixing the code in the PR, which can also help review code. :-)
LGTM. Like @zjffdu mentioned, one line comment with link to the issue will help.
Screenshots from zeppelin?

@srehmann  Thanks for the contribution.
Will merge if no more comments.

I tested before create this ticket, It looked like work but I found It's not enough...
(Zeppelin 0.7 also same issue... I think that `ng-autocomplete` has same but I'll test)

It needs more test.
Could you please make a simple test for it?
Thanks @woowahan-jaehoon Looking forward your further update.
Have added the unit test...

@zjffdu Local property support and docs have been added. I also fixed an issue in the credential injector where passwords with $ or / would cause an exception. I will create a Jira to back port that fix to the 0.8x branch since that PR already has been pulled.

Thanks @jpmcmu  It looks likes you didn't configure your travis, could you configure that so that the the CI can be enabled ? See guideline here. https://zeppelin.apache.org/contribution/contributions.html#continuous-integration
@jongyoul @felixcheung does the current version look ok? If yes, could it be merged?

Dear all,

I'm also interested in this; the problem does not seem to be solved in master.

@zjffdu resolve the conflicts. Not entirely sure how the changes would take effect in the newer zeppelin since this PR is quite old but I've resolved them as best as I could. Let me know what I should add more. I'll test the functionality later when I get more time for this.
Ah shit! Some unintended changes got creeped in. Stupid IDE... I'll do an update for this

@zjffdu oh much better now. You can have a look at it. 

There's this comment about interpreters and interpreter groups by @felixcheung that I want to look at later.
This may not be required after the next version of plugin will be released - it will allow to override this setting via command-line
LGTM, will merge if no more comments

@ShamsUlAzeem Please setup your travis to enable the CI. See guideline here. https://zeppelin.apache.org/contribution/contributions.html#continuous-integration

because this pr's repo have been deleted before, I pushed a new pr for this issue. https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3432

Thanks @curlsli 
Is it possible to add unit test to avoid regression ?
ping @Byeol
@bhavikpatel9977 The CI is failed. Could you do rebased and retrigger the CI ?
Can we merge this PR? it's really blocking me from working on new code :-(
LGTM, will merge if no more comment
LGTM

I found solution.
In `form` tag, `input` tag is separated by login's input tag.

Adding `autocomplete=off` attribute in `form` tag is more forcing method, but it's enough to solve.
Awesome, great progress @woowahan-jaehoon

Other than one minor comments LGTM!
I see one of Travis profile is failing which is unrelated

@ShamsUlAzeem Have you configured your travis to enable the CI ? https://zeppelin.apache.org/contribution/contributions.html#continuous-integration
@zjffdu yup I configured it a long time ago and it's working now as well. I'll do a couple of changes and run some tests before notifying you for updates.
Thanks @ShamsUlAzeem Seems the CI is still running, let's wait for the CI result.
@zjffdu Cool! But I haven't resolved the issues yet. I'll let you know when they're resolved. I just did a random commit to check the CI status
@zjffdu I've opened #3439 that should fix this problem - I believe that it's caused by fact that destination directory doesn't exist yet. I've added corresponding test case as well
@zjffdu solved the dependency issues and some zeppelin-web lint errors.
@zjffdu there are a couple of tests that I want to do with the repo for checking out the desired output. Also, have to resolve some of the review comments here then we'll be good to merge this.

@zjffdu hmm seems like the integration tests are failing because I upgraded the guava version to 22.0 from 20.0. They have remove the toStringHelper from Objects and have moved it to MoreObjects starting from version 21.0. I'll go and downgrade the version in the whole project to see if it can run the tests successfully.

@alexott Did you configure your travis ? I don't see your travis build.

https://zeppelin.apache.org/contribution/contributions.html#continuous-integration
@zjffdu https://travis-ci.org/alexott/zeppelin/builds/581065560 - as I see it fails only on some builds, and from brief look it's mostly because of the Drill dependencies

Thanks @alexott I saw this before, and believe it is flaky test, created https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-4322 to track this issue.

Will merge this PR if no more comments
@zjffdu I rebased because it has conflict. i think it was LGTM but not merge. Shall I work on something to make it to master ?
Thanks @AyWa , I am sorry that I forget to merge it. I will merge it after the CI completed
No problem :) by the way, the CI changed ? do I need to setup something ?
Did you configure your travis ? https://zeppelin.apache.org/contribution/contributions.html#continuous-integration
Yes, I just could not see the trigger. But I checked and the build fail. I will have a look
@AyWa There's some flaky test, let me know if you doubt the failed test is not related
I rebased and test succeeded. 😉
@AyWa where is the travis link ? Have you configured your travis ? It is weird that there's on travis CI link here.

Yeah, I don't know why it is not shown in the pr. It was shown until I fix the conflict yesterday.
https://travis-ci.org/AyWa/zeppelin/builds/581966561
Thanks, I will merge it soon

Thanks for the contribution @fdeantoni Does it keep backward compatibility ? I mean does it work in the non-proxy mode with the old configuration. 

And have you configured your travis ? I don't see the travis build link here.

The changes should be backwards compatible. The keyStore is only added if the property `zeppelin.livy.ssl.keyStore` is non-empty. If not provided behaviour should be exactly the same as before.

I just set up travis and triggered a build: https://travis-ci.org/fdeantoni/zeppelin
Thanks, PR LGTM
ping @jpmcmu
ping @yx91490
